definition: to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: The Hendersons seldom go to church, but they believe.
sentences.chinese: 亨德森一家很少去教堂做礼拜，但他们笃信宗教。

sentences.english: She goes to church only occasionally,but she believes.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔去教堂做礼拜，可是她笃信宗教。

sentences.english: According to Hamid, the members of its Portland community fit that mold at that time.
sentences.chinese: 据哈米德说，波特兰社区成员当时也笃信这一理念。

sentences.english: On the contrary I can throughly define what I believe.
sentences.chinese: 相反的，我能够完全定义出我所笃信的东西。

sentences.english: The Hendersons seldom go to church, but they believe.
sentences.chinese: 亨德森一家很少去教堂做星期，但他们笃信宗教。

sentences.english: They do not believe in Hinayana but in the primitive religion.
sentences.chinese: 该族群不信仰小乘佛教，而笃信传统的原始宗教。

sentences.english: It was with this championship of the rulers who believed in Buddhism that Buddhist music and dance thrived.
sentences.chinese: 正是在笃信佛教的统治者倡导下，佛教歌舞愈演愈盛。

definition: to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
superstition/to have a superstitious belief (in sth)
to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
religious belief/to practice a faith/to be religious
